title: New York City's Chelsea Market Expands Roster of Vendors
summary: Food hall aims to take advantage of its growing popularity among locals and tourists. The Chelsea Market is expanding yet again.

title: G-7 Summit Off to Rocky Start as U.S. Officials Assail France
summary: French president is accused of ignoring Washington's input and focusing event on 'niche' issues. BIARRITZ, France-The Group of Seven summit got off to a turbulent start Saturday as U.S. officials privately criticized President Emmanuel Macron for his handling of the meeting after the French leader invited President Trump to an impromptu lunch to press him on issues ranging from Iran to the fires in the Amazon.

title: BOE's Carney Says Trade War Imperils Global Growth
summary: 'The lesson from the Brexit is that these effects can be material'. JACKSON HOLE, Wyo.-Bank of England Gov. Mark Carney said global growth prospects are flagging due to a trade war pursued by Washington, creating new challenges for economic policy makers.

title: Parents Face a Growing Barrage of School Fees
summary: A $35 fee for cat cadavers in anatomy class is just one of the many charges-from books to registration-levied by districts. The cost of a free public education is on the rise, as a growing number of districts across the U.S. are charging students for registration, textbooks, the use of libraries and more.

title: Air Travel Hasn't Lost Its Magic
summary: Flying is more than a necessary evil: It's a way of escaping the limits of time and space.. I sometimes think of my father as a closet pilot, or what the Australian writer Clive James calls a "nonpracticing pilot": someone who has spent so much time in the air that he can speak with confidence about the mechanics of flight. Sitting on the terrace of his home in a suburb north of Copenhagen, he can nonchalantly point out a Boeing 777 coming from Singapore or, checking his wristwatch, an Airbus A340 taking off, probably bound for Chicago.

title: A New York City Tennis Permit Costs $100. Is That Too Much?
summary: Resume Subscription. Over the past five years, the New York City Parks Department has worked to make playing tennis in the city more accessible by lowering the price of the permits required to access courts, building more courts in neighborhoods across the city and expanding access for youth tennis programs.

title: Arun Jaitley, a Confidant of India's Modi, Dies at 66
summary: India's former finance minister was also the key troubleshooter for the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party. NEW DELHI-India's former finance minister, Arun Jaitley, who was one of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's closest aides, died Saturday after a prolonged illness. He was 66.

title: As Hong Kong Protesters Wave the Stars and Stripes, Some See Grist for Chinese Propaganda
summary: 'We want the U.S. to guard our rights,' says one flag waver. Scan the pro-democracy demonstrations roiling Hong Kong this summer, and you will likely spot a few American flags flapping in the teargas-laden air.

title: Long-Shot Democratic Candidates Shake Off Debate Disappointment
summary: Three Democrats have ended their campaigns this month, but others plan to stay in the race despite weak polling and fundraising. Three Democrats have ended their quest for the White House in the past 10 days. But plenty of other candidates are shrugging off their own weak polling and fundraising, making it likely the field will stay crowded well into the fall.

title: Hong Kong Erupts in Fresh Violence as Protesters, Police Brawl
summary: Demonstrators fought face to face with charging police, knocking some to ground and sending others scrambling back. HONG KONG-Protesters in helmets and gas masks clashed with riot police Saturday, as the city's pro-democracy movement took a confrontational turn after nearly two weeks of relatively peaceful turnouts.

title: 'Strange Light: The Photography of Clarence John Laughlin' Review: Snapping Southern Gothic
summary: The photographer's work stands in stark contrast to that of his modernist contemporaries as he aimed to expose disquieting layers of truth beneath the surfaces of things.. Atlanta

title: Clients Want to Work With Female Advisers, and Firms Are Taking Notice
summary: Resume Subscription. Over the past two years, Jane Schwartzberg, head of strategic client segments at UBS Group AG's U.S. wealth-management unit, has seen a marked increase in requests from prospective clients who want to work with female financial advisers.

title: Your Next Home Might Be Appraised by a Robot
summary: Regulators are moving to allow a majority of U.S. home purchases to be conducted without licensed appraisers. The next time you buy a house, your lender might deploy a drone and a computer algorithm to size up the property instead of a tape-measure-toting human appraiser.

title: China Releases Employee of U.K. Consulate in Hong Kong
summary: Simon Cheng returned home after being detained in China for 15 days. HONG KONG-An employee of the British consulate in Hong Kong has been freed after being detained in China for 15 days.

title: Cities Are Saying No to 5G, Citing Health, Aesthetics-and FCC Bullying
summary: Those hawking specious safety concerns about the new technology have found common cause with some of America's most powerful mayors. Jack Tibbetts, a member of the Santa Rosa, Calif., city council, knew he had a problem. It was early 2018, and he'd started getting calls from constituents at opposite ends of the political spectrum. The common thread: cellular antennas going up next to their homes, causing concerns over property values and health.

title: The Atlantic, Propped Up by Laurene Powell Jobs, Charts New Course
summary: The 162-year-old magazine to relaunch paywall after investment spree. Last year, the Atlantic put on hold its plans to launch a paywall at the behest of its new owner, Laurene Powell Jobs, according to people familiar with the matter. Ms. Powell Jobs, who had paid more than $100 million for a majority stake, wanted the magazine to first hire new staffers and improve its platform, betting that those changes would help expand offerings and draw more readers.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: When an Epidemic Threatens the Globe, This Doctor Jumps Into Action
summary: What it means to be the 'chief virus hunter' at a company that screens for the world's most contagious diseases. When an infectious disease threatens to become a pandemic, it is up to John Hackett to keep the world's blood supply safe. He is known as the "chief virus hunter" within Abbott Laboratories , where Dr. Hackett is in charge of a global team that plays a prominent public-health role whenever an outbreak occurs.

title: North Korea Fires Missiles After U.S.-South Korea Military Exercise Ends
summary: When asked if Kim Jong Un had violated his trust, President Trump said: 'No, I don't think so. He likes testing missiles.'. North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles off the country's east coast, Seoul officials said, as the Kim regime continues testing weapons despite telling President Trump the provocations would stop.
